PARAGRAPH.STRING: (3,238 m) is a mountain in the Urner Alps of Switzerland.
is located in the canton of Obwalden in Switzerland, overlooking Engelberg and

is famous as the site of the world's first revolving cable car. The cable car system connects Engelberg to the top through four principal stages (Gerschnialp, Tr√ºbsee, Stand and Kleintitlis (3,020 m).
The last part of cable car way leads above the glacier. In Kleintitlis, it is possible to visit a glacier cave.
